channel.title: Kudo! Programming for 8 year olds +
channel.description:
Yeah Kodu is a free programming environment where you can create fun little things on the Xbox or PC. They mainly only use if else statements which they call "When" and "Do". There is no hard programming but it is very basic. It's designed for 8 year olds in elementary school who want to get a grip on it. I have to design a game for children that involves saving the environment and stuff. So anyways heres the link. http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/projects/kodu/
What do you guys think of this? Good or bad? Only problem with this is, it get's kids dependent on GUI editors and it's basically drag and drop.

item.title: Kudo! Programming for 8 year olds +
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:38, topic:420613”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=523160.msg3808238#msg3808238 date=1320667122]

Correct me if I’m wrong but isn’t this just doing JAVA for you?

When will you guys learn that not everything revolves around Java.

Sonds like it would take a hell of a long time to code on an xbox…

Nope. It’s hard to explain. You click program, then an interface shows up thats says when, then you click when and a whole bunch of options show up. It’s harder to program on the PC than on an Xbox.

I hope you’re trolling…

That’s why I said correct me.
[/quote]

Well since it is a high level language, can be ran on the Xbox, and it’s created by Microsoft, it’s most likely using the .NET platform with XNA.[/quote]

It is. Why do you hope I’m trolling?

Read full topic

item.title: Kudo! Programming for 8 year olds +
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“judostar1, post:6, topic:420613”]yeah, ik its for 8 years olds, but maybe adding basic java would improve their knowledge[/quote]Sure chuck in some Java in a C# or C++ program… I’m pretty sure 8 year olds don’t need to be dealing with code syntax in which they don’t understand. Give kids who aren’t mature enough yet a chunk of code and they’ll post “got 100 errors, now what?” on the closest forums.

Read full topic
